snippet: Rabbi Menachem Youlus, who fraudulently claimed he had found Torahs hidden or lost during the Holocaust, was sentenced to over four years in prison on Thursday.
abstract: Rabbi Menachem Youlus is sentenced in Federal District in Manhattan to over four years in prison after pleading guilty to two counts of fraud; Youlus fabricated accounts of rescuing Torahs that he claimed had been hidden or lost during the Holocaust and then selling them to synagogues or individuals in honor of loved ones lost during the atrocities; Rabbi Youlus is also required to pay victim restitution of $990,000.
lead_paragraph: Rabbi Menachem Youlus, who fraudulently claimed he had found Torahs hidden or lost during the Holocaust, was sentenced to over four years in prison on Thursday.

headline.seo: Rabbi, Called Jewish Indiana Jones, Is Sentenced in Torah Plot
headline.main: Torah Fraud Earns Rabbi Prison Term
headline.print_headline: Torah Fraud Earns Rabbi Prison Term
